showScoreExcerpt: “Simard is delicious; the rest of the show, if you turn off your brain, is merely yummy in a candy-coated way. That’s not nothing: ‘Once Upon a One More Time’ is a well-assembled and entertaining diversion...Musicals are capable of more ambitious roles than merely carrying Spears.”

keyPhrases.quote: Musicals are capable of more ambitious roles than merely carrying Spears

llmScore.reasoning: Claude: The review offers qualified praise calling it an 'entertaining diversion' but criticizes the show's lack of ambition and suggests it requires turning off your brain, indicating mixed feelings with slight positive lean. | GPT-4o-mini: The review highlights strong performances but suggests the show lacks depth, leading to a mixed-positive recommendation.
